p:
The sum of the overpotentials is represented in Fig. 4d as a function of the C-rate. Thus, for all C-rates the overpotentials are higher for Î²-Ni(OH) 2 than for the doped samples. Thus, the kinetic energy loss L kinetic(Ni) for materials Ni-B and NiFe20 at 4C represents 1.9% and 1.5% of energy efficiency loss, respectively, for a full cell charging at and C c = 2 C d according to eqn (4). This decrease of the kinetic overpotential induced by doping can be explained by a better ionic and electronic pathway as explained earlier and will allow a reduction of the energy loss.
